announcements.title: Welcome to Introduction to Programming
announcements.content: Welcome to CSE110! I'm excited to have you all in this course. Please review the syllabus and let me know if you have any questions.
announcements.author: John Doe

announcements.title: First Assignment Posted
announcements.content: The first assignment has been posted. Please complete it by the due date. Feel free to use the discussion forum if you have any questions.
announcements.author: John Doe

announcements.title: Office Hours Change
announcements.content: Please note that my office hours will be changed to Tuesdays and Thursdays from 2-4pm starting next week.
announcements.author: John Doe

announcements.title: Welcome to Data Science Essentials
announcements.content: Welcome to CSE430! This course will introduce you to the fundamentals of data science. We'll be using Python for most of our work, so please make sure you have it installed.
announcements.author: Jane Smith

announcements.title: Dataset Resources
announcements.content: I've added some additional dataset resources to the course page. These will be useful for your upcoming projects.
announcements.author: Jane Smith

announcements.title: Guest Lecture Announcement
announcements.content: We will have a guest lecture from Dr. Alex Johnson, a data scientist at Google, next Thursday. Attendance is mandatory as this will be part of your final grade.
announcements.author: Jane Smith

announcements.title: Welcome to Web Development Bootcamp
announcements.content: Welcome to the Web Development Bootcamp! In this course, you'll learn how to build modern web applications from scratch. We'll be using VS Code as our primary IDE.
announcements.author: Michael Johnson

announcements.title: Project Groups
announcements.content: Project groups have been formed and posted on the course page. Please check your assigned group and contact your team members this week.
announcements.author: Michael Johnson

announcements.title: Additional Resources for React
announcements.content: I've posted some additional resources for learning React on the course page. These include tutorial links and example code repositories.
announcements.author: Michael Johnson

announcements.title: Midterm Exam Date
announcements.content: The midterm exam will be held on February 15th. It will cover all material taught up to week 5. A review session will be held the week before.
announcements.author: Michael Johnson
